questions.questionText: Enter the primitive data types available in JavaScript.

feedback.correctAnswer: Well done! That is the correct response.
feedback.wrongAnswer: Not quite. There are 6 total primitive types. A new one was added with ES6.

questions.questionText: Which keyword is used to declare block-scoped variables?

feedback.correctAnswer: Well done! That is the correct response.
feedback.wrongAnswer: Sorry, that is inccorrect. let allows you to declare block-scoped variables.

questions.questionText: Everything in JavaScript with the exception of primitive values are objects.

feedback.correctAnswer: Well done! That is the correct response.

questions.questionText: What command is used to convert an object to a JSON string?

feedback.correctAnswer: Well done! That is the correct response.
feedback.wrongAnswer: Not quite. Using the JSON object, you access the stringify method: JSON.stringify().
